name: Reims
fun_fact: Fun fact: Reims Cathedral is where French kings were crowned for over 1,000 years - it's to France what Westminster Abbey is to England! And beneath Reims lie literally MILES of champagne cellars holding 200 million bottles in ancient Roman chalk quarries!

hero_dishes.name: Biscuits Roses de Reims
hero_dishes.description: Pink, crunchy, egg-and-sugar cookies designed specifically for dipping in champagne
hero_dishes.origin_story: First created by Fossier's Confectioners in the 18th century (founded 1756), the recipe remains shrouded in mystery to this day. These light, rose-colored treats are traditionally covered in icing sugar with a crunchy texture perfect for dunking in bubbly.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Fossier bakery (founded 1756) - the original and still the best. Look for them as you stroll between champagne houses!

hero_dishes.name: Regional French Classics
hero_dishes.description: Authentic French cuisine featuring artisanal cheeses, charcuterie, smoked fish from local artisans
hero_dishes.origin_story: Reims' restaurants total eight Michelin stars, making it one of France's smartest food scenes. The city blends technical mastery with responsibly sourced, seasonal ingredients from Champagne region producers.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: L'Alambic (vaulted cellar, Chef Ansel Fabrice's fresh local ingredients), L'Epicerie Au Bon Manger (wine bar and gourmet deli with artisanal cheeses, organic champagnes), Le Coq Rouge (tapas-style small plates, mix with the winemakers near the Cathedral)

hero_dishes.name: Michelin-Starred Experiences
hero_dishes.description: World-class fine dining showcasing seasonal Champagne region ingredients
hero_dishes.origin_story: Reims has evolved into a culinary destination with three 3-Michelin-star, two 2-star, and multiple 1-star restaurants. The 2025 Reims Gastronomic Festival celebrates the 10th anniversary of Champagne's UNESCO designation.

signature_drinks.name: Champagne (MoÃ«t, Veuve Clicquot, Taittinger, Pommery, etc.)
signature_drinks.description: The world's most famous sparkling wine, produced in the chalk cellars beneath Reims
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Champagne houses line the city - Veuve Clicquot (yellow label, Madame Clicquot invented the first vintage in 1810 and riddling table in 1816), Pommery (self-guided tours in UNESCO Gallo-Roman cellars), Taittinger, Ruinart. Enjoy with biscuits roses de Reims! There are MILES of underground cellars holding 200 million bottles. The 2015 UNESCO World Heritage designation put even more spotlight on the region. Book Veuve Clicquot tours 2-3 weeks ahead - they sell out!

signature_drinks.name: Natural Wines and Organic Champagnes
signature_drinks.description: Small-scale producer champagnes and European wines focused on terroir and craftsmanship
